Description: Fragment from front of head of terracotta figure of Demeter. A head broken from a large figure of Demeter, with a veil over her head, the hair, parted in the centre, showing below; she may wear earrings, but not certainly so. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous orange-brown Nile silt with a red and grey core; a few traces of a white dressing.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3330)
Condition: On her right side the hair and veil are lost, and all the rear is broken away; the nose is injured.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
